means: 暴动，闹事( riot的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The streets are still full of debris from two nights of rioting.
sentence.Network_cn: 街道上仍到处可见连续两晚的骚乱留下的残迹。

sentence.Network_en: In the country's largest cities there has been rioting and looting.
sentence.Network_cn: 该国的大城市有暴乱和抢劫发生。

sentence.Network_en: The protests escalated into five days of rioting.
sentence.Network_cn: 抗议升级为为期5天的骚乱。

PerfectNetExp.abs: They are rioting against the government ., 他们反对政府而掀起暴动.
The number of dead and injured in the rioting is not yet known ., 在那次暴动中死亡和受伤的人数还不知道.
a curfew was declared in Xinjiang province following the rioting that left 156 people dead and about 1,000 others injured since Sunday .新疆发生种族骚乱，自星期天以来，已造成至少156人死亡，大约1千人受伤；政府已宣布实行宵禁。
an outbreak of typhoid , hostilities , rioting ., 伤寒的发作 , 战争的爆发 , 暴乱的发生.

list.abs: 「暴动小猫」(Pussy Riot)乐队成立于2011年八月，正好是俄国的新反对运动浪潮的开端。普京塑造了俄罗斯以民粹主义民主为外衣， …
俄罗斯总理梅德韦杰夫认为，女子朋克乐队“造反猫咪”(Pussy Riot)没有必要继续留在监狱。但他同时强调，这只是其个人观点，因为 …
一些翻译~（转的~） ... restitute 恢复，赔偿 riot police 防暴警察 root off 根除.
run ragged 破旧无用run riot 跟错踪迹run round in circles 忙得团团转
42年前，石墙暴动（Stonewall riots）推动了如今同性恋权利运动，在这些运动失败的2年后，纽约（美国人口最密集的州）终于将同 …

entry.def: When there is a riot, a crowd of people behave violently in a public place, for example they fight, throw stones, or damage buildings and vehicles.

example.ex: Twelve inmates have been killed during a riot at the prison.
example.tran: 12名犯人在一场监狱暴乱中被杀害。

entry.def: If people riot, they behave violently in a public place.

example.ex: Last year 600 inmates rioted, starting fires and building barricades...
example.tran: 去年，600名犯人闹事，他们纵火并设置路障。

example.ex: They rioted in protest against the government.
example.tran: 他们发动暴乱，以抗议政府的行为。

entry.tran: 五颜六色;丰富多彩;各种各样
entry.def: If you say that there is a riot of something pleasant such as colour, you mean that there is a large amount of various types of it.

example.ex: All the cacti were in flower, so that the desert was a riot of colour...
example.tran: 所有的仙人掌都开花了，整个沙漠里五彩缤纷。

example.ex: With Indian cuisine, you expect a riot of tastes and spices.
example.tran: 印度菜肴口味丰富，并添加各种香料。

entry.tran: 严厉警告…停止闹事;严厉警告…注意言行
entry.def: If someone in authority reads you the riot act, they tell you that you will be punished unless you start behaving properly.

example.ex: I'm glad you read the riot act to Billy. He's still a kid and still needs to be told what to do.
example.tran: 我很高兴你警告比利不许胡闹。他还是个孩子，仍然需要有人告诉他该做什么。

entry.tran: 失去控制;变得狂乱;无法无天
entry.def: If people run riot, they behave in a wild and uncontrolled manner.

example.ex: Rampaging prisoners ran riot through Strangeways jail.
example.tran: 斯特兰韦斯监狱里那些狂暴的囚犯们全都失去了控制。

entry.tran: (想象力等)狂野，不受拘束，任意发挥
entry.def: If something such as your imagination runs riot, it is not limited or controlled, and produces ideas that are new or exciting, rather than sensible.

example.ex: A conservatory offers the perfect excuse to let your imagination run riot.
example.tran: 音乐学院让你有充分的理由任想象力自由驰骋。

example.ex: We have no proof and when there is no proof, rumour runs riot.
example.tran: 我们没有证据，只要没有证据，谣言就会满天飞。

means.word_mean: 1. a state of disorder involving group violence

auth_sentence.content: There was mass rioting on the streets of Lhasa.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was mass rioting on the streets of Lhasa.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was mass rioting on the streets of Lhasa.

auth_sentence.content: The rioting kids weren't making him a god.
auth_sentence.res_content: The rioting kids weren't making him a god.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The rioting kids weren't making him a god.

auth_sentence.content: Their deaths unleashed three weeks of rioting across France.
auth_sentence.res_content: Their deaths unleashed three weeks of rioting across France.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Their deaths unleashed three weeks of rioting across France.

sentences.en: His conviction caused rioting in the streets.
sentences.cn: 他被判有罪,引起了街头骚动。

sentences.en: The local media reported rioting across the country.
sentences.cn: 当地媒体报道了全国范围的骚乱。
